channel.title: Free Music?
channel.description:
Is there any program(s) like LimeWire (without a shit ton of viruses) to get music for my ipod?
I heard of Frostwire before, but I don't know if I should trust it.
EDIT: And i'm not wasting my money on Itunes. So don't say that.

item.title: Free Music?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

People people just stop being stupid and just get rhapsody

Read full topic

item.title: Free Music?
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

xryz:

mp3boo.com . i also use real player to download videos from yt. you can convert it to mp3 after u download it–from the same program. i also have orbit downloader but i havent used it to download yt vids yet, which it can do.

Sounds pretty nice, I might use it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

laurent 248:

Anyway on W7 you can’t get that type of problem. They fix the icon to go with Windows XP and I use Itunes to play all my musics. So they don’t have any chances to get me because they fix the icon to windows media player or stuff like that

makes .exe file with itunes icon and fake iTunes GUI
“Please enter your Apple ID and Password”
Problem?

item.title: Free Music?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:39, topic:381970”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=477774.msg3505691#msg3505691 date=1298141771]

Truth is you really can’t trust anything, FrostWire may have some protection but its really all up to who uploaded the file. The best way I have found is to search Mediafire for the song name or album because they virus scan every file uploaded and they have had every single song I have wanted so far.
[/quote]Do you know how people put viruses in MP3 files?

I think it’s impossible.

So what causes the risk of viruses?

On “____wire” people can name their file “superepicsong.mp3” but with a “.exe” at the end as the real extension, and even change the icon. But only a true idiot would fall for something like that.

Can’t people do that on just about any filesharing network?[/quote]
Not trusted mp3 sites that only allow .mp3 extensions.

Read full topic

item.title: Free Music?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Its like this:

file name | ext

|niggermusic.mp3 | .exe |

Which is what causes the problem I believe, although all it takes is a brain to rightclick -> props and see the ext there.

Read full topic

item.title: Free Music?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:1, topic:381970”]Is there any program(s) like LimeWire (without a shit ton of viruses) to get music for my ipod?

I heard of Frostwire before, but I don’t know if I should trust it.

EDIT: And i’m not wasting my money on Itunes. So don’t say that.[/quote]
bittorrent and fenopy.com, best way ever or you could use beemp3.com or you could do something like this
download imesh
download tunebytes (off of a warez site)
use to free imesh trial to get tons of music albums
use tunebytes to strip away to copyright locks.

easy as… anything really…
but yeah stick with torrenting
